description: [New Zimbabwe] SOUTHERN African Development Community (SADC) health ministers have called upon governments to mobilize alternative funding sources to sustain critical health programs, including HIV, tuberculosis (TB), and malaria prevention, treatment and control.
title: Africa: African Countries Urged to Mobilise Alternative Funding for HIV, TB and Malaria Prevention Amid Financing Crisis

description: [Premium Times] The world is rushing to secure Africa's critical minerals, will Africa negotiate from a position of strength, or will it once again be a spectator in its own story? The choice is clear.
title: Africa: AfCFTA and Critical Minerals At Geopolitical Crossroads

description: [Premium Times] The agency said the slash in the USAID programme is part of a review to significantly reduce US foreign assistance to countries.
title: Africa: Trump to Slash USAID's Foreign Assistance Budget By 92 Percent

description: [Premium Times] Elon Musk told a US Cabinet meeting that the Department of Government Efficiency had made mistakes as it cut jobs and programmes in recent weeks.
title: Africa: US Dept 'Accidentally' Cut Ebola Prevention Funding - Elon Musk

description: [Bhekisisa] Pepfar-funded HIV organisations in South Africa, who receive their funds through the United States Agency for International Development, USAID, woke up to letters that were sent overnight telling them their grants have been ended -- permanently.
title: Africa: Trump Orders USAID-Funded HIV Organisations in South Africa to Shut Down

description: [CFR] Three years ago, Washington was busy marshaling an alliance of the world's democracies against Russia.
title: Africa: Uncle Sam Goes Rogue

description: [The Conversation Africa] Following seven rounds of balloting, 60-year-old diplomat Mahmoud Ali Youssouf was elected the sixth chair of the African Union Commission in February 2025. Politics professor Ulf Engel, who is the editor of the Yearbook on the African Union, explains the role and its challenges.
title: Africa: African Union's New Chair Has a Long List of Tough Tasks - What It Will Take to Get Them Done

description: [Premium Times] The global health body said it is partnering with the WHO Foundation, to leverage its 150 country offices and the foundation's global reach to amplify the campaign's impact
title: Africa: WHO Adopts Crowdfunding Campaign Amid U.S. Funding Withdrawal

description: [CAF] The first round of qualifiers for the TotalEnergies CAF Women's Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2026 concluded on Wednesday night with Algeria, Mali, Togo and Kenya among the teams that excelled and advanced to the second round.
title: Africa: TotalEnergies CAF Awcon Morocco 2026 - First Round of Qualifiers Conclude - Algeria, Mali Advance

description: [ISS] This week's G20 finance meeting must galvanise a global climate agenda to mitigate the grave impact of the US withdrawal.
title: Africa: US Paris Climate Agreement Exit Will Hit Africa Hard

description: [The Conversation Africa] The US decision to withdraw from the Paris Agreement has raised questions about whether progress can still be made on global policy to mitigate climate change. To explore these questions, Imraan Valodia, pro vice-chancellor: climate, sustainability and inequality and director of the Southern Centre for Inequality Studies at the University of the Witwatersrand, spoke to Professor Sir David King, who founded the Climate Crisis Advisory Group, a collection of influential, diverse, and interdisciplinary
title: Africa: Climate Talks - Global South Must Seize the Moment and Take the Lead

description: [The Conversation Africa] Throughout human history, disease outbreaks have emerged and re-emerged. What's different now is that with global travel, outbreaks can move quickly among and between populations.
title: Africa: We Should Care More About Emerging Infectious Diseases, and the Tools We Need to Fight Them

description: [The Conversation Africa] One of Africa's giant beetles is just one step away from extinction. New research has found that one species of the enormous Goliath beetles has been almost wiped out by the west African cocoa industry and, to a lesser extent, by the international trade in dried insects. Luca Luiselli, a professor of biostatistics and ecology at the University of Lomé (Togo), has researched threatened species in African forests for 30 years. He explains what has gone wrong and how the Goliath beetle could be saved.
title: Africa: World's Largest Insect Faces Extinction - How to Save Two Species of Africa's Giant Goliath Beetle

description: [The Conversation Africa] In a January 24 interview with the far-right-wing outlet Breitbart News, newly appointed CIA director John Ratcliffe stated that assessing intelligence on a potential Wuhan lab leak was a top priority. The following day, The New York Times reported that the agency had shifted from an undecided stance to favoring a possible Chinese lab leak, albeit with a "low confidence" rating-the lowest on a three-tier scale (low, medium, high)-indicating the evidence remains inconclusive.
title: Africa: The 'Lab-Leak Origin' of Covid-19. Fact or Fiction?

description: [allAfrica] In the past 20 years, tobacco use has dropped by one-third globally, and there are an estimated 118 million fewer tobacco users today compared with 2005.
title: Africa: The Tobacco Epidemic Is One Of The World's Deadliest Threats - A Global Compact Is Combating It

description: [allAfrica] Kigali, Rwanda -- In the health sector, the fast adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) will lead to a major shift
title: Africa: 'AI Not a Substitute for Human Intelligence' But Innovations Are Reshaping Global Surgery

description: [UN News] Shuttered clinics and health workers laid off around the world reflect the widespread, negative toll the United States funding freeze is taking on the global AIDS response, according to a new situation report released on Wednesday by the UN agency charged with responding to the disease.
title: Africa: New Report Flags Severity of Us Funding Cuts to Global Aids Response
